page_analysis.text_content:
Primary daylight plane (rear)

Fig 23 Side elevation showing Rear primary daylight plane

Note: There is no front daylight plane.

7.5' max. each protrusion
5' min. separation
7.5' max. each protrusion

24' max. for protrusions

Max building height is:
• 30' for structures w/ roof slope < 12:12
• 33' for structures w/ roof slope > 12:12
• 17' for structures on substandard or flag lots regardless of flood plane
• variable for structures located in flood zones except on substandard and flag lots - up to 33'

Cumulative length of protrusions must not exceed 15' on any one side.
Rear protrusions subject to same rules as side protrusions

60°

16'

24' max. for protrusions

Max. bldg. height

Setback line
Rear yard
Rear lot line

Notes:
• Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.
• Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

28

visual_elements.description: Side elevation drawing of a house showing the rear primary daylight plane with multiple dimensional annotations. The drawing includes two dormer protrusions on the roof, each with a maximum width of 7.5 feet, separated by a minimum of 5 feet. Vertical height limits and angles are marked, including a 60° angle from the rear setback line, a 16-foot vertical measurement, and a 24-foot maximum height for protrusions. The maximum building height is indicated with a dashed vertical line. The drawing also shows the setback line, rear yard, and rear lot line. Notes and labels clarify measurement points and restrictions.

technical_specifications.parameter: Maximum cumulative length of protrusions on any one side
Maximum building height for structures with roof slope < 12:12
Maximum building height for structures with roof slope > 12:12
Maximum building height for structures on substandard or flag lots regardless of flood plane
Maximum building height for structures located in flood zones except on substandard and flag lots
Angle of daylight plane from rear setback line
Vertical height from rear setback line to daylight plane

additional_notes: Page number 28 at bottom left corner.
Note states: 'There is no front daylight plane.'
Notes clarify that side daylight plane is measured up at lot line and rear daylight plane is measured up at rear setback.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Image quality is clear with all text and measurements legible.
cross_references: Fig 23 referenced as the figure showing the rear primary daylight plane.

qualifiers.text: There is no front daylight plane.
Rear protrusions subject to same rules as side protrusions
Variable for structures located in flood zones except on substandard and flag lots - up to 33'

conditions.text: Max building height is 30' for structures w/ roof slope < 12:12
Max building height is 33' for structures w/ roof slope > 12:12
Max building height is 17' for structures on substandard or flag lots regardless of flood plane
Max cumulative length of protrusions must not exceed 15' on any one side
Variable max building height for structures located in flood zones except on substandard and flag lots - up to 33'
Max width of each protrusion is 7.5'

logical_relationships.expression: Each protrusion must be <= 7.5' wide AND protrusions must be separated by >= 5' AND cumulative length of protrusions must not exceed 15' on any one side

IF roof slope < 12:12 THEN max building height = 30' ELSE IF roof slope > 12:12 THEN max building height = 33' ELSE IF structure on substandard or flag lot THEN max building height = 17' ELSE IF structure in flood zone except substandard and flag lots THEN max building height up to 33'

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate roof slope and lot type to determine applicable max building height (c1, c2, c3, c5)
Check protrusion widths and separations (c6, c7) and cumulative length (c4)
Verify protrusion height does not exceed maximum (c8)
